title: Pre-workshop set-up
text: Please, follow these instructions carefully to get ready at least one day before the workshop.

title: Pre-workshop set-up
text:
Pre-requisites
Before installing the necessary software, make sure you have installed or updated the following software.

The latest version of R (https://cloud.r-project.org).
The latest version of RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download).
Your operating system is up-to-date.

title: Pre-workshop set-up
text:
Installation






Important



If you have previously installed the C++ toolkit or if you have recently updated your OS, please follow these instructions to reinstall them.


Now you will need to install a few packages and extra software.
Here is an overview of what you will install:

C++ toolchain.
R packages: tidyverse, brms, tidybayes, extraDistr.


1. Install the C++ toolchain
The package brms used in the workshop requires a working C++ toolchain to compile models.

Windows
For Windows, follow the instructions here: https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/Rtools/rtools43/rtools.html


macOS
For macOS, open the Terminal and write the following line then press enter/return:
xcode-select --install
You’ll see a panel that asks you to install the Xcode Command Line Tools. Install them. Downloading and installation will take 30 to 60 minutes.


Linux
For Linux, follow the instructions here: https://github.com/stan-dev/rstan/wiki/Configuring-C-Toolchain-for-Linux



2. Install the R packages
You need to install the following packages:
install.packages(c("tidyverse", "brms", "tidybayes", "extraDistr", "HDInterval"))
It will take several minutes to install the packages, depending on your system and configuration.
If after opening the workshop project in RStudio you get asked to install extra packages or software, please do so.


Check your installation
Run the following in the RStudio Console:
example(stan_model, package = "rstan", run.dontrun = TRUE)
If you see some strange looking text printed in the Console and then fit and fit2 in the Environment, then you are sorted!

title: Pre-workshop set-up
text:
Troubleshooting
If you are having issues with installation, the best place to ask for help are:

The Stan Forums: https://discourse.mc-stan.org
StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com
Any search engine.

title: 01 - Introduction
text:
Statistical modelling

From McElreath 2019

title: 01 - Introduction
text:
Statistical inference

The inference process

title: 01 - Introduction
text: Two frameworks of inference

title: 01 - Introduction
text:
Frequentist framework


Neyman-Pearson’s Null Hypothesis Significance Testing (NHST).
Based on frequentist interpretation of probabilities as long-run occurrences of events.
Output:

Point estimates of predictors’ parameters (with standard error).
p-values.

title: 01 - Introduction
text:
Bayesian framework


Bayesian inference.
Based on the Bayesian interpretation of probabilities as degree of belief in the occurrence of events.
Output:
Probability distributions of model’s parameters.

title: 01 - Introduction
text:
Bayesian regression: basics


R package brms.
Same syntax as lme4.
One function to fit many types of regression models: brm().

title: 01 - Introduction
text:
Example data: background


Effect of consonant voicing on preceding vowel duration in Italian and Polish.
pVCV words (/a, o, u/, /t, d, k, g/).
11 Italian speakers, 6 Polish speakers. 5 repetitions.

title: 01 - Introduction
text:
Example data: the data frame

library(coretta2018itapol)
data("token_measures")

token_measures

# A tibble: 1,343 × 53

title: 01 - Introduction
text: Vowel duration and consonant voicing

title: 01 - Introduction
text: Vowel duration

title: 01 - Introduction
text:
Gaussian model of vowel duration
\[
\begin{align}
dur & \sim Gaussian(\mu, \sigma)
\end{align}
\]

\(dur\) is vowel duration
\(\sim\) means “is distributed/generated according to”.
\(Gaussian(\mu, \sigma)\) a Gaussian distribution with mean \(\mu\) and standard deviation \(\sigma\).

title: 01 - Introduction
text:
Fit the model with brms

m_1 <- brm(
  v2_duration ~ 1,
  family = gaussian,
  data = token_measures,
  cores = 4,
  file = "data/cache/m_1",
)

title: 01 - Introduction
text:
Model summary

summary(m_1)

 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = identity 
Formula: v2_duration ~ 1 
   Data: token_measures (Number of observations: 1342) 
  Draws: 4 chains, each with iter = 2000; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup draws = 4000

Regression Coefficients:
          Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept    78.10      0.84    76.45    79.78 1.00     2657     2561

Further Distributional Parameters:
      Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
sigma    31.33      0.60    30.19    32.54 1.00     3320     2578

Draws were sampled using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Bulk_ESS
and Tail_ESS are effective sample size measures, and Rhat is the potential
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).

title: 01 - Introduction
text:
Model summary: 80% CrIs

summary(m_1, prob = 0.8)

Formula: v2_duration ~ 1

  Draws: 4 chains, each with iter = 2000; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup draws = 4000

Regression Coefficients:
          Estimate Est.Error l-80% CI u-80% CI Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept    78.10      0.84    77.02    79.17 1.00     2657     2561

Further Distributional Parameters:
      Estimate Est.Error l-80% CI u-80% CI Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
sigma    31.33      0.60    30.57    32.10 1.00     3320     2578

Draws were sampled using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Bulk_ESS
and Tail_ESS are effective sample size measures, and Rhat is the potential
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).

title: 01 - Introduction
text:
Plot posterior probability distributions

plot(m_1, combo = c("dens", "trace"))

title: 01 - Introduction
text:
Diagnostics: posterior predictive checks

pp_check(m_1, ndraws = 50)

title: 01 - Introduction
01 - Introduction
text:
Fit the log-normal model

m_2 <- brm(
  v2_duration ~ 1,
  family = lognormal,
  data = token_measures,
  cores = 4,
  file = "data/cache/m_2",
)

Posterior predictive checks

title: 03 - Categorical predictors
text: Vowel duration by voicing

title: 03 - Categorical predictors
text:
Categorical predictors: treatment contrasts (default)
\[
\begin{align}
vdur_i & \sim LogNormal(\mu, \sigma)\\
\mu & = \beta_0 + \beta_1 \cdot \text{voiceless}_i \\
\beta_0 & \sim Gaussian(\mu_0, \sigma_0)\\
\beta_1 & \sim Gaussian(\mu_1, \sigma_1)\\
\sigma & \sim Cauchy_{+}(0, \sigma_2)\\
\end{align}
\]

title: 03 - Categorical predictors
text:
Get default priors

get_prior(
  v1_duration ~ c2_phonation,
  family = lognormal,
  data = token_measures
)

                  prior     class                  coef group resp dpar nlpar
                 (flat)         b                                            
                 (flat)         b c2_phonationvoiceless                      
 student_t(3, 4.6, 2.5) Intercept                                            
   student_t(3, 0, 2.5)     sigma                                            
 lb ub       source
            default
       (vectorized)
            default
  0         default

title: 03 - Categorical predictors
text:
Categorical predictors: indexing
\[
\begin{align}
vdur_i & \sim LogNormal(\mu_i, \sigma)\\
\mu_i & = \beta_{voicing[i]}\\
\beta_j & \sim Gaussian(\mu_j, \sigma_j) & , \text{for } j = 1..2\\
\sigma & \sim Cauchy_{+}(0, \sigma_3)\\
\end{align}
\]

title: 03 - Categorical predictors
text:
Get default priors: indexing

get_prior(
  v1_duration ~ 0 + c2_phonation,
  family = lognormal,
  data = token_measures
)

                prior class                  coef group resp dpar nlpar lb ub
               (flat)     b                                                  
               (flat)     b    c2_phonationvoiced                            
               (flat)     b c2_phonationvoiceless                            
 student_t(3, 0, 2.5) sigma                                              0   
       source
      default
 (vectorized)
 (vectorized)
      default

title: 03 - Categorical predictors
text:
Priors

m_4_priors <- c(
  # Prior for both `b` coefficients
  prior(normal(4.45, 0.55), class = b),
  prior(normal(0, 0.1), class = sigma)
)

m_4_priors

              prior class coef group resp dpar nlpar   lb   ub source
 normal(4.45, 0.55)     b                            <NA> <NA>   user
     normal(0, 0.1) sigma                            <NA> <NA>   user

title: 03 - Categorical predictors
text:
Prior predictive checks

my_seed <- 9682

m_4_priorpp <- brm(
  v1_duration ~ 0 + c2_phonation,
  data = token_measures,
  family = lognormal,
  prior = m_4_priors,
  sample_prior = "only",
  cores = 4,
  seed = my_seed,
  file = "data/cache/m_4_priorpp"
)

title: 03 - Categorical predictors
text:
Prior predictive plots

conditional_effects(m_4_priorpp)

title: 03 - Categorical predictors
text:
Fit the model

m_4 <- brm(
  v1_duration ~ 0 + c2_phonation,
  data = token_measures,
  family = lognormal,
  prior = m_4_priors,
  seed = my_seed,
  cores = 4,
  file = "data/cache/m_4"
)

title: 03 - Categorical predictors

Posterior probability distributions: outcome (vowel duration)

conditional_effects(m_4)

title: 03 - Categorical predictors
section: Posterior probability distribution: difference of vowel duration
text:
Posterior probability distribution: difference of vowel duration

library(marginaleffects)

avg_comparisons(m_4, conf_level = 0.8)


         Term                       Contrast Estimate 10.0 % 90.0 %
 c2_phonation mean(voiceless) - mean(voiced)    -10.9  -13.2  -8.63

Columns: term, contrast, estimate, conf.low, conf.high, predicted_lo, predicted_hi, predicted, tmp_idx 
Type:  response

text:
Posterior probability distributions

package
function

brms
conditional_effects()


Difference
marginaleffects
avg_comparisons()

title: 05 - Numeric predictors
05 - Numeric predictors
text: Vowel duration by speech rate

title: 05 - Numeric predictors
text:
Numeric predictors
\[
\begin{align}
vdur_i & \sim LogNormal(\mu_i, \sigma)\\
\mu_i & = \beta_{1,voicing[i], language[i]} + \beta_2 \cdot \text{spr_c}\\
\beta_{1jw} & \sim Gaussian(\mu_j, \sigma_j) & , \text{for } j = 1..2\\
&  &  w = 1..2\\
\beta_2 & \sim Gaussian(\mu_3, \sigma_3)\\
\sigma & \sim Cauchy_{+}(0, \sigma_4)\\
\end{align}
\]

title: 05 - Numeric predictors
text:
Get default priors: indexing

get_prior(
  v1_duration ~ 0 + c2_phonation:language + speech_rate_c,
  family = lognormal,
  data = token_measures
)

                prior class                                  coef group resp
               (flat)     b                                                 
               (flat)     b    c2_phonationvoiced:languageItalian           
               (flat)     b     c2_phonationvoiced:languagePolish           
               (flat)     b c2_phonationvoiceless:languageItalian           
               (flat)     b  c2_phonationvoiceless:languagePolish           
               (flat)     b                         speech_rate_c           
 student_t(3, 0, 2.5) sigma                                                 
 dpar nlpar lb ub       source
                       default
                  (vectorized)
                  (vectorized)
                  (vectorized)
                  (vectorized)
                  (vectorized)
             0         default

title: 05 - Numeric predictors
text:
Priors

m_6_priors <- c(
  # Priors for the four `b` coefficients
  prior(normal(4.45, 0.55), class = b, coef = `c2_phonationvoiced:languageItalian`),
  prior(normal(4.45, 0.55), class = b, coef = `c2_phonationvoiced:languagePolish`),
  prior(normal(4.45, 0.55), class = b, coef = `c2_phonationvoiceless:languageItalian`),
  prior(normal(4.45, 0.55), class = b, coef = `c2_phonationvoiceless:languagePolish`),
  prior(normal(0, 0.5), class = b, coef = `speech_rate_c`),
  # Prior for sigma
  prior(normal(0, 0.1), class = sigma)
)

m_6_priors

              prior class                                  coef group resp dpar
 normal(4.45, 0.55)     b    c2_phonationvoiced:languageItalian                
 normal(4.45, 0.55)     b     c2_phonationvoiced:languagePolish                
 normal(4.45, 0.55)     b c2_phonationvoiceless:languageItalian                
 normal(4.45, 0.55)     b  c2_phonationvoiceless:languagePolish                
     normal(0, 0.5)     b                         speech_rate_c                
     normal(0, 0.1) sigma                                                      
 nlpar   lb   ub source
       <NA> <NA>   user
       <NA> <NA>   user
       <NA> <NA>   user
       <NA> <NA>   user
       <NA> <NA>   user
       <NA> <NA>   user

my_seed <- 5293

  prior = m_6_priors,
  sample_prior = "only",

  data = token_measures,

title: 05 - Numeric predictors
text:
Posterior probability distributions: outcome (vowel duration)

conditional_effects(m_6, effects = "language:c2_phonation")

title: 05 - Numeric predictors
section: Posterior probability distribution: difference of vowel duration
text:
Posterior probability distribution: difference of vowel duration

library(marginaleffects)

# In milliseconds
avg_comparisons(m_6, variables = "c2_phonation", by = "language", conf_level = 0.8)


         Term                       Contrast language Estimate 10.0 % 90.0 %
 c2_phonation mean(voiced) - mean(voiceless)  Italian    12.74  10.49  14.99
 c2_phonation mean(voiced) - mean(voiceless)  Polish      6.93   4.84   9.11

Columns: term, contrast, language, estimate, conf.low, conf.high, predicted_lo, predicted_hi, predicted, tmp_idx 
Type:  response 

# As ratio
avg_comparisons(m_6, variables = "c2_phonation", by = "language", conf_level = 0.8, comparison = "ratio")


         Term                       Contrast language Estimate 10.0 % 90.0 %
 c2_phonation mean(voiced) / mean(voiceless)  Italian     1.12   1.09   1.14
 c2_phonation mean(voiced) / mean(voiceless)  Polish      1.09   1.06   1.12

Columns: term, contrast, language, estimate, conf.low, conf.high, predicted_lo, predicted_hi, predicted, tmp_idx 
Type:  response

title: 05 - Numeric predictors
text:
Posterior predictive checks

pp_check(m_6, ndraws = 100)

title: 05 - Numeric predictors
text:
Non-linear effects: GAMs

m_6a <- brm(
  v1_duration ~ 0 + c2_phonation:language + s(speech_rate_c, k = 3),
  data = token_measures,
  family = lognormal,
  seed = my_seed,
  cores = 4,
  file = "data/cache/m_6a"
)

title: 05 - Numeric predictors
text:
Posterior probability distributions: outcome (vowel duration)

conditional_effects(m_6, effects = "speech_rate_c")

 b2=b1  -0.0195 -0.0562 0.0178

Columns: term, estimate, conf.low, conf.high 
Type:  response

title: Learn Bayesian modelling for Phonetology

This is the website of the workshop learnB4P.
Check out the set-up page for instructions on software requirements.

title: 04 - Interactions
04 - Interactions
section: Vowel duration by voicing and language
text: Vowel duration by voicing and language

title: 04 - Interactions
text:
Categorical predictors: interactions
\[
\begin{align}
vdur_i & \sim LogNormal(\mu_i, \sigma)\\
\mu_i & = \beta_{voicing[i], language[i]}\\
\beta_{jw} & \sim Gaussian(\mu_j, \sigma_j) & , \text{for } j = 1..2\\
&  &  w = 1..2\\
\sigma & \sim Cauchy_{+}(0, \sigma_3)\\
\end{align}
\]

title: 04 - Interactions
text:
Get default priors: indexing

get_prior(
  v1_duration ~ 0 + c2_phonation:language,
  family = lognormal,
  data = token_measures
)

                prior class                                  coef group resp
               (flat)     b                                                 
               (flat)     b    c2_phonationvoiced:languageItalian           
               (flat)     b     c2_phonationvoiced:languagePolish           
               (flat)     b c2_phonationvoiceless:languageItalian           
               (flat)     b  c2_phonationvoiceless:languagePolish           
 student_t(3, 0, 2.5) sigma                                                 
 dpar nlpar lb ub       source
                       default
                  (vectorized)
                  (vectorized)
                  (vectorized)
                  (vectorized)
             0         default

title: 04 - Interactions
text:
Priors

m_5_priors <- c(
  # Prior for the four `b` coefficients
  prior(normal(4.45, 0.55), class = b),
  # Prior for sigma
  prior(normal(0, 0.1), class = sigma)
)

m_5_priors

              prior class coef group resp dpar nlpar   lb   ub source
 normal(4.45, 0.55)     b                            <NA> <NA>   user
     normal(0, 0.1) sigma                            <NA> <NA>   user

title: 04 - Interactions
text:
Prior predictive checks

my_seed <- 1382

m_5_priorpp <- brm(
  v1_duration ~ 0 + c2_phonation:language,
  data = token_measures,
  family = lognormal,
  prior = m_5_priors,
  sample_prior = "only",
  cores = 4,
  seed = my_seed,
  file = "data/cache/m_5_priorpp"
)

title: 04 - Interactions
text:
Prior predictive plots

conditional_effects(m_5_priorpp, effects = "language:c2_phonation")

title: 04 - Interactions
text:
Fit the model

m_5 <- brm(
  v1_duration ~ 0 + c2_phonation:language,
  data = token_measures,
  family = lognormal,
  prior = m_5_priors,
  seed = my_seed,
  cores = 4,
  file = "data/cache/m_5"
)

title: 02 - Priors
text:
Vowel duration
\[
\begin{align}
vdur & \sim Gaussian(\mu, \sigma)\\
\end{align}
\]

Pick a \(\mu\) and \(\sigma\).
Report them here: https://forms.gle/HRzH5CworngWrBv16.

title: 02 - Priors
text: Proposed distributions of vowel duration

title: 02 - Priors
text: Bayesian belief update

title: 02 - Priors
text:
Priors
\[
\begin{align}
vdur & \sim LogNormal(\mu, \sigma)\\
\mu & \sim Gaussian(\mu_1, \sigma_1)\\
\sigma & \sim Cauchy_{+}(0, \sigma_2)\\
\end{align}
\]

title: 02 - Priors
text:
Get default priors

get_prior(
  v1_duration ~ 1,
  family = lognormal,
  data = token_measures
)

                  prior     class coef group resp dpar nlpar lb ub  source
 student_t(3, 4.6, 2.5) Intercept                                  default
   student_t(3, 0, 2.5)     sigma                             0    default

title: 02 - Priors
text: Prior probability distributions

title: 02 - Priors
text: The empirical rule

title: 02 - Priors
text: The empirical rule

title: 02 - Priors
text: The empirical rule

title: 02 - Priors
text: The empirical rule

title: 02 - Priors
text: The empirical rule

title: 02 - Priors
text:
Priors of the model
\[
\begin{align}
vdur & \sim LogNormal(\mu, \sigma)\\
\mu & \sim Gaussian(\mu_1, \sigma_1)\\
\sigma & \sim Cauchy_{+}(0, \sigma_2)\\
\end{align}
\]


Let’s pick \(\mu_1\) and \(\sigma_1\).
We can use the empirical rule.

title: 02 - Priors
text:
Prior for \(\mu\)
\[
\begin{align}
vdur & \sim LogNormal(\mu, \sigma)\\
\mu & \sim Gaussian(\mu_1, \sigma_1)\\
\sigma & \sim Cauchy_{+}(0, \sigma_2)\\
\end{align}
\]


Let’s say that the mean vowel duration is between 50 and 150 ms at 95% confidence. In logs, that would be log(50) = 3.9 and log(150) = 5.
Get \(\mu_1\)

mean(c(3.9, 5)) = 4.45

Get \(\sigma_1\)

(5 - 3.9) / 2 = 0.55

title: 02 - Priors
text:
Prior for \(\mu\)
\[
\begin{align}
vdur & \sim LogNormal(\mu, \sigma)\\
\mu & \sim Gaussian(\mu_1 = 4.45, \sigma_1 = 0.55)\\
\sigma & \sim Cauchy_{+}(0, \sigma_2)\\
\end{align}
\]

title: 02 - Priors
text: Prior for \(\mu\): plot

title: 02 - Priors
text:
Prior for \(\sigma\)

library(HDInterval)

round(inverseCDF(c(0.975), ptrunc, spec = "cauchy", a = 0, scale = 0.1))

[1] 3

round(inverseCDF(c(0.975), ptrunc, spec = "cauchy", a = 0, scale = 0.2))

[1] 5

round(inverseCDF(c(0.975), ptrunc, spec = "cauchy", a = 0, scale = 0.3))

[1] 8

title: 02 - Priors
text:
Prior for \(\sigma\): plot

ggplot(tibble(x = c(0, 2)), aes(x = x)) +
  stat_function(fun = dtrunc, geom = "area", fill = "tomato4",
                args = list(spec = "cauchy", a = 0, scale = 0.1))

title: 02 - Priors
text:
Prior predictive checks: sample prior

my_seed <- 3485

m_3_priors <- c(
  prior(normal(4.45, 0.55), class = Intercept),
  prior(cauchy(0, 0.1), class = sigma)
)

m_3_priorpp <- brm(
  v1_duration ~ 1,
  family = lognormal,
  prior = m_3_priors,
  data = token_measures,
  sample_prior = "only",
  cores = 4,
  file = "data/cache/m_3_priorpp",
  seed = my_seed
)

summary(m_3_priorpp)

title: 02 - Priors
text:
Prior predictive checks: plot

set.seed(my_seed)
m_3_pppreds <- posterior_predict(m_3_priorpp, newdata = tibble(y = 1), ndraws = 1e3) |>
  as.vector()

ggplot() +
  aes(x = m_3_pppreds) +
  geom_density(fill = "forestgreen") +
  geom_rug(alpha = 0.25)

title: 02 - Priors
text:
Prior predictive checks: plot (zoom in)

ggplot() +
  aes(x = m_3_pppreds) +
  geom_density(fill = "forestgreen") +
  geom_rug(alpha = 0.25) +
  xlim(-100, 500)

title: 02 - Priors
text:
Run the model

m_3 <- brm(
  v1_duration ~ 1,
  family = lognormal,
  prior = m_3_priors,
  data = token_measures,
  cores = 4,
  file = "data/cache/m_3",
  seed = my_seed
)
